alert.note: Alert for Estancia Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...DRY MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CIBOLA, VALENCIA, SOUTHWESTERN SANTA FE, BERNALILLO AND NORTHWESTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 439 PM MDT, Doppler radar and the public reported strong downburst winds along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Mesita to Belen and 9 miles west of Escabosa. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, southwestern Rio Rancho, Valencia, Los Lunas, Corrales, Belen, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Bosque Farms, Edgewood and Peralta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 121 and 194. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 188 and 235. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Blowing dust associated with downburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times. Strong crosswinds can create hazardous travel for large and high profile vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Estancia Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; West Central Highlands
